(L) - Train may leave this stop 5 minutes early.

(d) - Train stops to discharge passengers only and may depart ahead of schedule. Passengers boarding at these stations should arrive at least 10 minutes early.

(R) - ONLY trains designated with an R at the top of the column will operate when limited service conditions or special circumstances warrant. On days of heavy snowfall or other severe weather, MARC will operate this special schedule. Additional stops marked with an R will be made when this schedule is in effect. See the 【73†PDF schedule】 for complete R schedule details.

(R+) - Train will operate or add additional stops when the R+ schedule is operated, in addition to trains with an R at the top of the column.

(C) - Connecting bus operated by Eastern Panhandle Transit Authority (EPTA). You must have a MARC-issued ticket with a destination in West Virginia or purchase a MARC ticket from the ticket machine in the station at Brunswick to ride the bus. EPTA is responsible for this bus and operation is subject to continued funding from the State of West Virginia.

[Image 30: Bikes Allowed] All MARC trains provide accommodation for full-size, non-collapsible bikes. Look for illuminated green lights or a large green reflective decal with the bike symbol on the outside of the railcar and board at the adjacent door. Method of securement for bicycles varies between railcar types; passengers must bring two (2) bungee cords to secure their bicycles. 【75†Click here for more details】.

content.title: MARC | PENN - WASHINGTON | Maryland Transit Administration

parts:
The MARC train schedule for tomorrow, June 7, 2024, includes the following departures for the Penn Line from Washington to Baltimore and other stops along the route:

**From Washington (Union Station) towards Baltimore:**
- Early morning trains start at 5:48 AM and continue roughly every 20-30 minutes until 8:19 AM.
- Mid-morning trains include departures at 9:17 AM, 10:28 AM, and 11:25 AM.
- Afternoon trains depart at 12:35 PM, 1:35 PM, and 2:31 PM.
- Evening service includes trains at 4:17 PM, 5:01 PM, 5:46 PM, and 6:30 PM.
- Later departures are at 7:33 PM, 8:25 PM, and 9:45 PM.

**Key stops and times:**
- New Carrollton: 6:03 AM, 6:15 AM, 6:46 AM, 7:03 AM, 7:38 AM, 7:48 AM, 8:02 AM, 8:19 AM, 8:56 AM, 9:17 AM, 9:58 AM, 10:28 AM, 11:25 AM, 12:35 PM, 1:35 PM, 2:31 PM, 3:43 PM, 4:17 PM, 4:45 PM, 5:01 PM, 5:46 PM, 6:30 PM, 6:45 PM, 7:33 PM, 8:25 PM, and 9:45 PM.

For a detailed schedule including all stops and more precise timings, please visit the [Maryland Transit Administration's official MARC Train schedule page](https://www.mta.maryland.gov)【6†source】【7†source】【8†source】.

Schedule from Baltimore
To DC please

(L) - Train may leave this stop 5 minutes early.

(d) - Train stops to discharge passengers only and may depart ahead of schedule. Passengers boarding at these stations should arrive at least 10 minutes early.

(R) - ONLY trains designated with an R at the top of the column will operate when limited service conditions or special circumstances warrant. On days of heavy snowfall or other severe weather, MARC will operate this special schedule. Additional stops marked with an R will be made when this schedule is in effect. See the 【73†PDF schedule】 for complete R schedule details.

(R+) - Train will operate or add additional stops when the R+ schedule is operated, in addition to trains with an R at the top of the column.

(C) - Connecting bus operated by Eastern Panhandle Transit Authority (EPTA). You must have a MARC-issued ticket with a destination in West Virginia or purchase a MARC ticket from the ticket machine in the station at Brunswick to ride the bus. EPTA is responsible for this bus and operation is subject to continued funding from the State of West Virginia.

[Image 30: Bikes Allowed] All MARC trains provide accommodation for full-size, non-collapsible bikes. Look for illuminated green lights or a large green reflective decal with the bike symbol on the outside of the railcar and board at the adjacent door. Method of securement for bicycles varies between railcar types; passengers must bring two (2) bungee cords to secure their bicycles. 【75†Click here for more details】.

parts:
The MARC train schedule for tomorrow, June 7, 2024, from Baltimore to Washington, D.C. (Union Station) on the Penn Line includes the following departures from Baltimore's Penn Station:

- **Early morning trains**: 5:15 AM, 6:03 AM, 6:15 AM, 6:46 AM, and 7:03 AM.
- **Mid-morning trains**: 7:38 AM, 7:48 AM, 8:02 AM, 8:19 AM, and 8:56 AM.
- **Late morning to early afternoon**: 9:17 AM, 9:58 AM, 10:28 AM, 11:25 AM, and 12:35 PM.
- **Afternoon trains**: 1:35 PM, 2:31 PM, 3:43 PM, 4:17 PM, and 4:45 PM.
- **Evening trains**: 5:01 PM, 5:46 PM, 6:30 PM, 6:45 PM, 7:33 PM, 8:25 PM, and 9:45 PM.

For more details and the complete schedule, please visit the [Maryland Transit Administration's official MARC Train schedule page](https://www.mta.maryland.gov)【14†source】【15†source】【16†source】.

Please tell me the most efficient way to take the Marx train from Baltimore to DC tomorrow and see the major sites. Starting at the capitol and walking down the mall and ending at Lincoln memorial. What is the most efficient use of public transportation

To visit major sites in Washington, D.C., efficiently using public transportation from Baltimore, follow these steps:

1. **Take the MARC Train from Baltimore to Washington, D.C.**:
   - Depart from Baltimore Penn Station. Recommended departure times for an early start include the 7:38 AM or 8:02 AM trains.
   - Arrive at Washington Union Station (approximately a 1-hour trip).

2. **Start at the Capitol Building**:
   - From Union Station, you can walk to the Capitol Building. It’s about a 10-minute walk, approximately 0.5 miles south along First St NE/SW.

3. **Walk Down the National Mall**:
   - Begin at the Capitol and head west along the National Mall.
   - Major sites you will pass include:
     - The U.S. Capitol Building
     - The National Gallery of Art
     - The Smithsonian Museums (like the National Museum of American History and the National Museum of Natural History)
     - The Washington Monument
     - The World War II Memorial

4. **End at the Lincoln Memorial**:
   - Continue west past the Reflecting Pool until you reach the Lincoln Memorial.

5. **Return to Union Station**:
   - To get back to Union Station, you have several options:
     - **Metro**: Walk to the nearest Metro station. The closest one near the Lincoln Memorial is the Foggy Bottom-GWU Metro Station (about a 15-20 minute walk). Take the Blue, Orange, or Silver Line to Metro Center, and transfer to the Red Line towards Glenmont or Silver Spring to Union Station.
     - **Bus**: The DC Circulator's National Mall route runs between the Lincoln Memorial and Union Station. Check the schedule for the next bus departure.
     - **Walk**: If you prefer, you can walk back along the National Mall, but it will take about 45 minutes to an hour depending on your pace and stops along the way.

### Detailed Directions and Public Transportation Tips:

- **MARC Train Schedule**: Ensure you have the latest MARC train schedule from Baltimore Penn Station to Washington Union Station. The MARC Penn Line typically runs frequently during the weekdays.
- **Metro and Bus Info**: Use the WMATA website or apps like Moovit to get real-time information on Metro and bus services in Washington, D.C. The DC Circulator website will also provide schedules and route maps.

By following this plan, you can efficiently see the major sites in Washington, D.C., starting from the Capitol Building, walking down the National Mall, and ending at the Lincoln Memorial, while utilizing public transportation effectively.
